context: The word 'räägivad' is the 3rd person plural present form of the Estonian verb 'rääkima', which means 'to talk', 'to speak', or 'to say'. It refers to when multiple people are talking/speaking. For example, in the first sentence 'Tüdrukud räägivad kodus' means 'The girls are talking at home.' The word is formed from the root verb 'rääkima' + '-gi-' (present tense marker) + '-vad' (3rd person plural ending).
